questions.question_text:
An administrator is installing vCenter Server for an environment that has 40 ESXi 6.x Hosts and 150 virtual machines.
Which database would meet the minimal requirements needed for this task?

discussion.content:
Must Be C, vFabric Postgres only support 20 Hosts and 200 Vm
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2109850
20 hosts and 200 VMs max limit per vpostgres embedded/windows vcenter. But question mentioned 40 hosts - is that a typo?

questions.question_text:
An administrator is creating a new Virtual SAN cluster on a Layer 2 network. There is an existing Virtual SAN cluster on the same Layer 2 network.
Which two actions would allow the new Virtual SAN cluster to coexist with the older cluster? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Create an ARP Alias for the Virtual SAN VMkernel Network Adapter.
choices.B: Change the default Unicast Address on the new Virtual SAN Cluster.
choices.A: Change the default Multicast Address on the new Virtual SAN cluster.
choices.C: Create a separate VLAN for each cluster.

choices.B: VM Network port group adapters are connected to different switch.
choices.C: Physical NICs are migrated to different switch.
choices.D: VM Network adapters are connected to this switch.
choices.A: Vmkernel interfaces on the switch are still in use.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is unable to remove an ESXi 6.x host from a vSphere Distributed Switch.
What are two likely reasons for this issue? (Choose two.)

choices.D: SAS controllers in RAID10 mode AB

questions.question_text: Which two storage controller configurations can be used with Virtual SAN? (Choose two.)

An administrator has been tasked with enabling High Availability (HA) on a cluster in a vSphere 6.x environment with default settings. The cluster configures properly and there are no errors.
The next day when powering on a virtual machine, an error is presented:

Not Enough Failover Resources -
Which three scenarios are likely causes of this error message? (Choose three.)

choices.D: There are virtual machines with large CPU reservations.
choices.A: The default VM Monitoring Sensitivity is set too high.
choices.E: A host is in maintenance mode for a replacement of a failed Hard Drive.
choices.B: There are not enough datastore heartbeat datastores configured by default.
choices.C: The default slot size in the cluster is set too high.
